Summary: The proposal aims to integrate biologically inspired dynamic gating mechanisms into computational models of attention, combining hierarchical predictive coding, reinforcement-driven gating, and spiking neural networks. It includes a comprehensive experiment plan for validation, benchmarking, and clinical relevance testing.
Strengths: Comprehensive experiment plan covering multiple validation steps.
Weaknesses: Feasibility of integrating all proposed components is questionable.
Lacks detailed discussion on computational challenges (e.g., SNN scalability).
Limited discussion on potential technical risks and mitigation strategies.
Questions: How will the computational cost of integrating SNNs be managed?
What are the specific challenges in combining hierarchical predictive coding with reinforcement-driven gating?
How will interpretability of the integrated model be ensured?
What are the fallback plans if any component fails to integrate as expected?
Limitations: High computational cost of spiking neural networks.
Complexity of integrating multiple biologically inspired mechanisms.
Potential difficulty in scaling to whole-brain simulations.
Risk of overfitting in clinical relevance testing.
